website_summaries.verdict: Expect this hollow rubber squirrel to be tossed, chewed, and bounced by your dog as they relentlessly batter it to extract the treats, cheese, or peanut butter you hide behind its reliable “Treat Meter” prongs.
pros: Rubber prongs keep treats inside for longer, maximizing playtime
Removable prongs to adjust frequency of treat releases

customer_reviews.title: Larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because they were less expensive than Kongs, which I fill with almond butter and freeze for my fur-kids. They are about the size of the large kong which I was not expecting (I didn't really check the size, so my fault). They have some rubber prongs at the larger opening which I imagine is designed to hold onto a solid treat, although as they are rubber, not sure how effective that would really be. My pups are little (7, 11 and 13 lbs) so I wish these came in a smaller size. They also have a very distinct smell which I find a bit offputting. We will see what a run through the dishwasher does.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Great "KONG" type toy!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to purchase a KONG for my pup, but I did not want to spend the high prices on the official KONG. I found this purple squirrel and it has been GREAT. On the inside there are little rubber tabs that are sturdy and help hold the kibble I place inside. It's super easy to clean out, I use my fingers or a baby bottle scrubber to get the inside. I have used this to feed my dog his kibble nearly every day for the past 6 months and it has been GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible perfumey/rubbery smell
customer_reviews.text: What's with the awful smell? It's not just a rubber odor -- it's like a perfume. Yuck. And it's _really_ strong. Dog noses are super sensitive -- why would a dog toy try and overwhelm their sense of smell like this? I could understand if it smelled like chicken, or cheese, but this is just gross.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: great for aggressive chewers!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 yr old pittie who usually demolishes any toy within 5 minutes. Until now, the only toy she hasn't broken is the black kong. This has lasted over a week so far and it keeps the treats securely inside to hold her attention!
customer_reviews.author: Ashleyh

customer_reviews.title: Finally a toy he can't rip to shreds!
customer_reviews.text: So my wonderful Bernedoodle will take the most "indestructible" toy and gut it within an hour! Needed something to stimulate his mind, while keeping him out of trouble. This did the trick, load it up with kibble and he will bobble it around the house, eating as he goes. Have had it over 9 months and he still enjoys it. I bought several because I have two dogs and was fostering a Rottweiler and thought she would enjoy it and she did, when she went to her forever home, it was one of the toys I gave her new Mom.
customer_reviews.author: Laureen SWNJ

customer_reviews.title: Super durable
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is a pit mix and the definition of super chewer. Almost every toy we’ve bought has not lasted long. Squirrel dude is her new favorite, and she hasn’t been able to break it! It’s super thick and rubbery and it’s lasted about a week of almost non-stop chewing. She literally sat for a solid hour the other day just gnawing on it and it’s still holding up! She loves it and we don’t have bits of shredded toys scattered around the house. Update (April 20): this has been her favorite toy for 6 months now, and it still hasn’t broken! Best purchase ever.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: We feed our pup some of his meals from this, putting his kibble in the squirrel, and allowing him time to get it all out. Usually takes him about 10 to 15 minutes. Gives him something to do and us a bit of a break. We do not allow this to be left out as a toy, as we don’t want to find out if our puppy would/could chew it to pieces. It’s not a toy, it’s like our dogs food bowl - And it is put away once he’s done eating. It is a very heavy duty, sturdy item though... Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Girl

customer_reviews.title: It stinks!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this a very long time ago and lost it in the house. Our dog never really liked it, I think due to the smell. Smells like formaldehyde or like that - pretty offensive. I thought after finding it recently the smell would have gone - NOPE. Cant't believe the stink is still there and just as strong. So I just threw it out. It was fine otherwise. Not sure, but maybe it was a bad rubber batch. But if it wasn't beware of the stink!
customer_reviews.author: lynxs_claw

customer_reviews.title: Great for my larger dog. Cute and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7 month old black lab puppy who is already 65 lbs who loves chewing on everything. He steals the smaller Kong toys from our toy fox terrier so I got this huge size thinking it would take him longer to finish. It is great! Watching him push it around trying to get treats out is a riot. I did cut out one if the prongs for easier dispensing since he is a puppy. This is very sturdy, well made, nice for larger dogs. And it is a cute little animal shape.
customer_reviews.author: DenverMom46

customer_reviews.title: Too tough for small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Stupid toy for a small dog. She’s only six pounds and it’s ridiculous next to her. She can’t even turn it over. I said I was looking for toys for very small dogs, and they sent me a small one. I had never heard of KONGS before, so had no idea what to expect, but the rubber is like the rubber on a tire. It’s impossible for her to manipulate much less get a treat out of. She will play for a long time with anything that squeaks, it this KONG didn’t work for UIS at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Green

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Another 5 star review for this product. My dog loves this, I just put regular kibble inside and rows of rubber teeth prevent whatever treats are inside from falling out too easily like a regular Kong that’s smooth inside. Use a kong for peanut butter and this for treats. It’s holding up really well, tough and adds a lot of interest. This thing is great for a dog that likes treat dispensing toys and because it’s rubbery it won’t mess up wood floors like hard toys can. A great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper X

customer_reviews.title: The perfect dispenser
customer_reviews.text: We have tried a lot, but this one is a great one- doesn't require rolling around, she can chew on it to get the food out and it takes her longer than most other of these types of food dispenser gizmos. SHe's a very strong chewer and it took her over a year to finally chew its head off! This makes it one of the longest lasting of these slow feed toys that we have had. Gladly bought a second.
customer_reviews.author: JLM

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one, not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: First, i want to say the one positive thing about this product, it is very strong and well made. If my dog could stand the smell of it, I am sure it would last her a lifetime. However, this toy smells so much like a freshly cleaned and powdered baby that my dog will not go near it, even when stuffed with her favorite treats and peanut butter. I should have believed the other reviews and passed on it. I even put it through the dishwasher 3 times, but still can not get the overwhelming baby powder odor out of it. Sweet for humans, but overwhelming for pets who have so much more sensitivity in the noses than humans.
customer_reviews.author: Littlduck15

customer_reviews.title: After shipping it to Singapore I was more than disappointed to find that it stinks
customer_reviews.text: I started buying PetSafe brand as it used to say it was literally safe for pets because it was made with non-toxic plastic. After shipping it to Singapore I was more than disappointed to find that it stinks, and no matter that I washed it and left it in the sun for 2 months plus, it still stinks. It was made in China, and it smells like it. Ironically, I first bought the brand in Asia, and it was not smelly and of really good quality. But this one is dreadful. If you love your dogs and don't want to give them toxic plastic to chew on, do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.author: Must Love Dogs 1177

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, happy dog!
customer_reviews.text: This is my dog’s favorite toy! Just the right size for her to pick up and walk with (she is about 50 pounds), as well as the right amount of difficulty for getting the treats out. It works well for kibble as well as the occasional peanut butter. Seems very durable and well made. I will buy another when this one is worn- but we have had it for about 1 month and it is showing no signs of giving in. Go purple squirrel!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha G

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dog entertained
customer_reviews.text: My dog can take snacks out of a Kong in a heartbeat so I decided to try this one out because I hoped the rubber prongs on the bottom would make it more difficult. They totally do. It keeps my dog entertained for way longer. I can also put kibble in it because the rubber prongs hold the kibble in which is great for feeding my dog because he's a fast eater. It's pretty tough. He's chewed and chewed on it and it's still in great shape. You can also customize the difficulty by cutting off some of the prongs.
customer_reviews.author: thebigfiveone

customer_reviews.title: The Squirrel Dude is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy enjoys the squirrel dude! I really appreciate that there are prongs on the inside that we get to adjust. We did have to cut some of the prongs down a bit to make the treat dispensing easier. I also like that the prongs keep the food or treats in, so we don't have to cover the hole with something like peanut butter (which our puppy doesn't like). Our puppy is slowly getting the hang of it!
customer_reviews.author: Madi K

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy to keep your dogs busy
customer_reviews.text: I like to find toys for my dogs that not only makes them think but keeps them busy for a while. This toy was a big success. It's very cute and there is room inside for additional small toys that your fur babies may already have. I load the "tree" full of toys and my 2 dogs romp and play for a long time trying to get all the toys out.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 88 pound American bull dog mix. He destroys all toys within minutes- even the “indestructible” ones. I fill this with treats, peanut butter. Keeps him busy for an hour.
customer_reviews.author: holly tc

customer_reviews.title: Great for teething!
customer_reviews.text: These are great to fill with semi liquid treats that I blend up for my pup and then freeze. We do pumpkin, applesauce, sweet potatoes, banana, peanut butter...whatever you're dog likes that is safe...blend it up, put a cork in the small end, place them in a mug, fill with a funnel and stick them in the freezer. In a few hours you have a deathly treat that teething pups love! We tried doing treats in them but had to trim the pieces because my pup couldn't get the treats out and lost interest when I used them that way. Now she loves them because she know there is a frozen yummy inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amus

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4mo german shepard pup that gets into everything! But, thei toy, device is keeping him very occupied. I will get another so I have one that if filled, as he watches me closely when I prepare it for him. This has been his favorite toy for several weeks and his teeth make no impression of it. This thing is reallt well made. I put it in his crate at night so he doesn't get bored if he wakes before I do. Really and outstanding produst!
customer_reviews.author: Ralenda B.

customer_reviews.title: Strong smell
customer_reviews.text: I just received this a week ago. My dog seems to like it, because of the treat inside(of course). And the shape makes it more challenging than the Kong’s. However it comes with an unbearable chemical smell. It’s not harsh, but overwhelming. Imagine the whole room is filled with that smell. And I’m quite concerned if that’ll affect my dog’s health. I might return this if the smell remains this strong.
customer_reviews.author: A different name

customer_reviews.title: Smells horrible
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this toy due to the smell. Washed in dishwasher 3x and the smell of industrial plastic with sickly sweet fragrance just got worse. I can’t imagine offering this toy to my dogs as I couldn’t stand to be near it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Everard

customer_reviews.title: Only way to feed our Labrador
customer_reviews.text: We use these to exclusively feed our labrador. It helps to slow him down so that he doesn't inhale everything. This is his 3rd one-it usually lasts him about a year (think about being used 4-6 times a day-that's pretty good!) before we have to get him a new one. Kids get a kick out of asking him about where his 'squirrel' is-and he's happy to go get it and set it down by his food bin. Entertaining for everyone I guess!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Holding up so far
customer_reviews.text: The toy was a gift for a dog determined to destroy anything he gets his paws on. Despite his best efforts, the squirrel dude is still intact after 2 days. It has entertain and occupied this pampered pet on and off for the last two days, and we are hopeful that it will last for a while. The price was good for the quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Would be great except for the SMELL!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would be a less expensive version of the Kong and it is, but only if you can tolerate the horrible chemical smell. I've had it sitting outside in the sun for days to air out and no improvement. My puppies won't go near it because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Sprenger

customer_reviews.title: Awful!
customer_reviews.text: This is essentially a Kong clone, but the opening at the top is entirely too small. My tiny dog gave up in frustration trying to get basic kibble out of this. Kongs have larger openings on the same-sized pieces. So i returned this and found a much better Kong clone. Keep looking!
customer_reviews.author: Housemouse

customer_reviews.title: Better and cheaper than Kong
customer_reviews.text: It’s cheaper than Kong, but my dog love this one better than Kong. Have washed it in a dishwasher for several times but it still looks like new! Because the prongs, it is harder for her to get kibbles out of this one than Kong. It took my dog 1.5x longer to get all kibbles out of this thank she does with Kong.
customer_reviews.author: Gymnastics

customer_reviews.title: Bullmastiff puppy loves Large size of this!
customer_reviews.text: As our puppy grows fast to hit close to 100 lbs(oh no...), we decided to purchase large size instead of puppy version or smaller sizes. My husband and I loved the scent more than our pup did, but now she loves it. She learned using tongue around 12 weeks so she enjoyed a lot more then. Now she is 15 weeks, trying to get food out of this squirrel, so I am going to trim the prongs and open it up for her. Definitely recommended. Very sturdy and bounces everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great, durable, dog loves it. I purchased a large for my 45 Lbs Karelian bear dog mix. She loves it and has been unable to destroy it. Getting the opening to release treats reliably, but not too easily was a little tricky. I would recommend only trimming a little or not at all for the first week or two, then making adjustments after your dog has figured it out a little better. I like their bone shaped toy for treat dispensing a little more. But this one seems more durable and has that squishy chomp that my dog loves, while still working fine for treats. For my dog, I think this will last for many many years.
customer_reviews.author: Jalar

customer_reviews.title: My cocker spaniel is perfectly happy chasing this toy around
customer_reviews.text: My cocker spaniel is perfectly happy chasing this toy around, trying to coax out the kibble. The "fill hole" is surrounded by rubber nubs, which can be cut with scissors to adjust how quickly/easily The food is expelled. The nubs make this toy much more challenging versus a Kong of similar size. And since this toy is not symmetrical, the dog can control it better and it doesn't disappear under furniture (5 The bad: this toy has a pungent smell that cannot be washed away. It smells like vanilla and old rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: works very good.  But I cut 3 of the tabs back to nubs
customer_reviews.text: This works very good. But I cut 3 of the tabs back to nubs, because it's almost impossible for them to get treats out of it without it. It has at least 6 tabs in side. I like this much better than Kong, as the Kong doesn't have tabs at all, and they just fall out. My standard poodle (which is still a chewing puppy), likes this, and keeps him busy for awhile. He's hidden it outside right now, so he definitely likes it. It's a nice size. About 4-5 inches. The picture looks tiny, but it's not- just right size.
customer_reviews.author: quality & comfortTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Lab approved
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador is a beast when it comes to destroying toys. Super chewer, xtra tough mean nothing to her. This toy has held up over two weeks with ZERO damage. No teeth indentation, no snags... and as a bonus, the toy itself kinda smells like vanilla. She is very entertained with her squirrel dude.
customer_reviews.author: L. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for stuffing and freezing.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to stuff with some wet dog food and then I freeze it. It works well and so far has stood up to repeated use. While my dog lives to destroy chew toys, this one he just eats the food out and then mostly leaves it. It is easy to clean and has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: luebTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Great for throwing, keeping busy with food
customer_reviews.text: This is one of our dog's favorite toys. She is a power chewer and kongs last a week at best. We have had this for 4 months without a dent in it. Only wish it would hold a bit more dog food. It is a great way to slow down her eating. Ordering another, because she keeps hiding the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Hypomama

customer_reviews.title: Just like a Kong but does not feel as strong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an additional keep busy toy for my dog while at work. She already has a Kong and she loves it. I wanted to buy something I could stuff bits of her food or treats into. I was under the impression this product has multiple spaces to hide food in but it really is exactly like a Kong one hole in the middle - but the rubber doesn't feel as strong as a Kong. Will be returning
customer_reviews.author: PizzaEveryDayyyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Survived our dog' s teeth and jaw
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a European Shepard - working line- he has destroyed every toy purchased including the "indestructible" jolly egg. The buddy squirrel has survived over 1 year of use. Purchased second squirrel for my sons new puppy!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: neither of my dogs can get treats out
customer_reviews.text: my dogs can't get treats out of this unless they fall out because they're so small. both my pups are not big chewers, though, so this rubber is just a bit too hard for them. this would be great for strong chewers!
customer_reviews.author: Rae D

customer_reviews.title: Something's changed unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy in the past and my dog happily used it for 2.5 years. Got another but the quality has deteriorated - opening was too big and asymmetrical so it was hardly a challenge to get food out.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent...
customer_reviews.text: My big dog gets into EVERYTHING and chews it up in seconds...however this one...he loves. No damage and he's had it for several weeks already. LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: roxyn

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Rubber chemical stench. Had to throw away.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber smell is so overpowering my dog won't go near it. The smell is so bad and strong that I had to throw it away. I even tried to get the smell out but washing it in my dishwasher 10x but it didn't work. Don't waste your money. Your dog will hate the smell and will not use it.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good indestructible alternative
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love the generic kong with peanut butter frozen over-night. I wish more people would do this, it keeps your dogs occupied for an hour or so, depending on energy level. I guess just clean them once in awhile. Just a big glass bowl with super hot water with this laid inside would do the trick. I'd stay away from soap, too hard to get out of there. Really, your dogs won't get sick from tiny bits of spoiled whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Ben A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Instant hit!
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 month old Great Dane puppy loved this the moment it came out of the box! It is bigger than I expected, which is great since we have a giant breed. The little nubs on the inner part of the opening help to keep treats from falling out right away. The toy itself also smells good (I don't know if it's supposed to but it has a pleasant scent, ha!) and she was interested before we even put treats inside. We love this toy!
customer_reviews.author: GreatDaneMomTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I GAVE THIS TO A DALMATION WHO HAS ANXIETY AND SEPARATION ISSUES. IT WORKS GREAT KEEPING HER MIND BUSY AND ENTERTAINED. I CUT OFF ONE NUB AND PUT HER FOOD IN IT FOR HER TO GET OUT. ON OCCASION I'LL COVER THE END WITH PEANUT BUTTER.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki L.

customer_reviews.title: Approved by our dog
customer_reviews.text: we stuff this with peanut butter and freeze it for our dog to have in his crate when we are gone. By freezing them it lasts longer for him. We have filled, froze and he's chewed on it for months. So far it has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that has worked really well with my lab puppy. I had bought kongs for him but somehow he was not interested. I switched to this product and cut one of the prongs to make the treats/kibble fall out a bit easily and it worked like a charm. That means he play's with it longer and it keeps him more entertained thereby tiring him out. Not just this toy but he got hooked to Kong as well after experience squirrel dude. I recommend both products so your dog gets variety
customer_reviews.author: Anant

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell.
customer_reviews.text: The odor was so unpleasant I wouldn't ever give these to my dogs. I do not trust that they are non toxic. Too bad, they would have loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Lois DMW

customer_reviews.title: yeah
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and sturdy. Very well made. Got a size large for my 9 month 60lb german shepherd. Perfect size. I personally dont use it anymore as I feel its counter intuitive to alot of what I'm doing with obedience training. But if you want to distract your dog for 45 minutes then this will work once a day or so.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!!! Not good for chewers!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this toy for my 8 month old Borkie. She chewed open the area where you put treats within several minutes of okaying with it. Waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Senak

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a month now and this thing is a godsend. My dog plays with it everywhere and chews and chews and chews with no noticeable markings. Extra super durable for my puppy who loves to Chew everything but this has stopped her from chewing on things she knows she's not supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: The opening is way to narrow for the dog to get the treats out, even if I use small tiny treats.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Travels

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel, dude!
customer_reviews.text: I held off writing a review because it takes a little bit to see how long a toy lasts with my dog. She's lovely pit/pointer/border mix and has the ability to destroy even so-called highly durable toys within days/minutes. Squirrel Dude (SD) has been awesome! We just experienced Fourth of July San Diego fireworks and she just saw on the rug with SD preoccupied the entire time! Only two short barks and back to SD. I'd say that's a great toy! I'm ordering more tonight.
customer_reviews.author: T Kush

customer_reviews.title: strong unpleasant odor
customer_reviews.text: This item had such a strong unpleasant odor I moved it outside. I hope the odor will diminish over time. Even if it does, I'm not sure I will feel safe giving it to them to chew on.
customer_reviews.author: Patty B

customer_reviews.title: New Design
customer_reviews.text: The design change is not for the better. I have very aggressive chewing dogs and the thinner prongs do not make it as hard to get the treat. I am lucky if the dog is occupied for 15 minutes When the old design lasted up to 45
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for big dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this squirrel! I have large dogs, including two great dane puppies. Despite their best efforts, they have not been able to tear it up. I also purchased a blue penguin from the brand and sadly they were able to start chewing chunks off the edges fairly quickly. So purple penguin: definitely! Blue penguin: definitely not!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Coutu

customer_reviews.title: Dogs prefer this to Kong
customer_reviews.text: My border collies love these toys. I have had two different sizes. The rubber is a bit softer than a kong, so if you have an aggressive chewer, you should probably stick with those. This squirrel has a smaller hole to stuff food in the bottom than the kong, which means you can put less in there and it won't fall out. It also has little rubber tabs that help keep stuff in there. I like this toy better than the kong toys. I will probably order another one.
customer_reviews.author: jakesmom

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  More challenging than a Kong classic.
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! My older dog can chomp a big bone out of a Kong Classic in a matter of minutes... This Squirrel Dude keeps her going back to it all day, and even when I get home in the evening, she still grabs it and keeps trying to get the last of the morsels that are in it. They are GREAT! I just ordered another one!!! I still keep about 6 Kongs around to fill with goodies and freeze to keep my pups busy while I'm gone, but Squirrel Dude is awesome and more challenging for them.
customer_reviews.author: Girl of all Trades

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel Dude - 3. Kong - 0.
customer_reviews.text: Kongs were not standing up to my 12 pound dachshund. I was looking for an alternative. Squirrel Dude is now my go to product. I have 3 now and no issues in 12 months of ownership. Works well with frozen peanut butter as well as various milkbones and other treats. I wash in dishwasher (top rack). No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lya

customer_reviews.title: My crazy puppy loves her Squirrel Dude
customer_reviews.text: My 9 mo old puppy can tear pretty much anything apart and but she hasn't been able to damage it yet! She enjoys tossing her squirrel dude around and hunting for the treats that pop out. Hint: I fill it mostly with kibble and a few small treats to keep it interesting. She hasn't been able to damage it yet!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Landry

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to Kong. I like that you can adjust the difficulty by leaving or trimming the tabs. For my dog, I trimmed off just a couple of the tabs and that seems to be perfect. I often will just stuff this with his kibble before bed to give him something to do for a while and give him a chance to settle down. This and other food dispensing toys are wonderful for keeping him happy and providing mental stimulation.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Dog and Owner very happy
customer_reviews.text: Happy puppy Filled with food and kept him busy for about an hour. I think if I put larger treats in it then he might be busy for even longer. It smells rubbery but the scent went away after a little while It actually seems more durable than Kong toys and I like that it has little teeth on the bottom so I don't need to keep food inside with the use of peanut butter
customer_reviews.author: LenaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a huge disappointment, the odor from whatever this is made of was overpowering, it was an extreme strong perfume smell. Promptly returned.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Not great, there are better versions of this toy idea out there!
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good toy, butt not as well received by the pup as the classic Kong for some reason. The little prongs are a bit annoying. As-is, they're well suited to standard kibbles. You're able to cut them out if you'd like to customize the opening to fit in other treats. Once you commit to cutting a few off to fit in larger treats, there's no going back to kibbles from there! The matte, velvety texture of the toy is also a dust and hair magnet, unlike the smoother Kong. All in all, I'd forego this for a Kong!
customer_reviews.author: NCG

customer_reviews.title: I put Rice Krispies in it and plug the hole ...
customer_reviews.text: I put Rice Krispies in it and plug the hole with peanut butter. My dog loves it, but the smell of the plastic is so strong I can't stand to be in the same room with it, so I'm not sure it's healthy for my dog. And yes, I've washed it repeatedly and run it through the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Dog Interactivity
customer_reviews.text: Great dog interaction toy. I fill it with all sorts of goodies and it will keep him occupied for 30-45 mins. Holds a good amount too. I snipped all the prongs off because he was having trouble getting the stuff out even though they weren’t large pieces.
customer_reviews.author: RIRedd

customer_reviews.title: much better than the competition - hooray for prongs!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT for keeping Ojai occupied while we're eating, or when we have to leave her at home alone. If your kibble is large enough (we buy Natural Balance - the pieces are about the size of a dime and twice as thick) they stay in the squirrel well enough so that they don't just pour out. We generally fill the squirrel with kibble, then cover the hole with peanut butter and she spends a happy session snacking. The little prongs are a huge improvement over the wide openings in kongs and other similar toys. Rubber is very durable, although because we use it with food, Ojai doesn't really chew it when it's not full. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Great Treat Toy
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the black and red "original" Kongs and I have to say, the Buddy Squirrel keeps my dogs occupied much longer than their Kongs do. Also, it's very durable and has survived 2 power chewer pit bull mixes. I've had this toy for about a year now and though it has seen better days, it still has "life" in it yet. This past year, I have put this thing in the freezer several times (for frozen treats) and it's been through the dishwasher. It has sat outside for days in the yard in the heat and snow. This is one of the few toys that has held up to my dogs and I will certainly buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Omieluv

customer_reviews.title: Works great - but more of a tease if you put ...
customer_reviews.text: Have a pitbull-lab mix - avid chewer - and when I left all the little internal spike-y things on, she was unable to get the treats out. Works great - but more of a tease if you put larger treats in it. Occasionally she will get frustrated and I have to put in some smaller treats that come out a bit easier. My friends puppy also loves to go to town on it. Neither has destroyed it yet - although they aren't chewing on it constantly...
customer_reviews.author: Blair Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Love the purple Squirrel Dude
customer_reviews.text: Love the purple Squirrel Dude! It took a bit to find out the right combination of food, so my dog could have her dinner in it. The prongs slow down the last few bits, so I end up digging them out with my fingers. Unlike the Kong, the food can't just dribble out, so it keeps her busy and challenged. A good alternative to eating out of a bowl all the time. Check out the other reviews for great ideas for stuffing the Squirrel Dude. The medium/large is about the same as the XL Kong and holds about 1 c. of food. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Zen Elder

customer_reviews.title: Better than the kong
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old bulldog has every single kong toy out there and won’t touch them. Got her this busy buddy toy today and she’s been playing with it for over an hour. It does have a strong rubber smell, but she actually likes it. I got her the large size and it’s twice as big as her large kong for half the price. Will be buying more today.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Great for fast eater but not great for caging
customer_reviews.text: I slightly prefer the Kong to this toy but if my dog is in a very active move I will switch to this since she can roll it around and get rewarded. It delivers her dog food in a fun matter. So if your dog eats super quickly and gets itself sick, this would be a great toy. My dog is a snacker throughout the day. My dog is crated through part of the day and the kong is a slightly better tool than this when it comes to caging, since this toy is more fun when a dog can walk around and roll it and that is not as possible in a cage situation.
customer_reviews.author: papuangirl

customer_reviews.title: perfect for our sabertooth pup
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy has the teeth of a saber tooth. He destroys EVERYTHING. He gnaws and gnaws on this and has caused absolutely no damage to this squirrel. It is his favorite toy and will continue to be so. Would order again (though I don’t expect I’ll need to).
customer_reviews.author: Mica Tesh

customer_reviews.title: Virtually indestructible for aggressive chewer. He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog shreds and destroys almost every toy I give him but not thus one! Highly recommend! Keeps him busy trying to get the treats out.
customer_reviews.author: M. West

customer_reviews.title: Squirrel Dude
customer_reviews.text: While I think this will be nice for my friend's big dog, it stinks to high heaven! I tried soaking it for hours, added a little bit of bleach, and also put it outside in the freezing cold for a couple of days. The stink has only been reduced a little. It will also stink up anything laying next to it, so just use a little caution. I also purchased the "Twist 'n Treat" which has the same issue but the dog wasn't bothered by it at all...then again, he eats poop.
customer_reviews.author: Retrotronic

customer_reviews.title: It is very small
customer_reviews.text: It is very well made. I had to trim the inside due to my dog could not get the treats out of it. I just wish it was a bit bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Steve

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: My dog destroys most toys - this is my second squirrel - i bought the smaller one for those times i can't find the bigger one! i put broken up treats in when i go to work and this keeps my dog busy while i am gone. I have had the larger one for probably 2 years and it is still intact! Absolutely love this toy!
customer_reviews.author: A. Jasinski

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: It just didn't work for us as well as for others. The kibble didn't fall out very well, even after trimming the hole outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Little prongs hold in kibble; keeps it interesting
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves her squirrel buddy. We pack it with kibble and goodies and it keeps her busy. Better than a bowl any day of the week.
customer_reviews.author: SpicyCopperTop

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!  Cute too!
customer_reviews.text: My large dog is an aggressive chewer. This is sturdy and durable. I don't know how long it will last but he loves it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: myfams

customer_reviews.title: 90 lb dog loves it, has not damaged it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, it keeps my 90 lb dog entertained for hours with some food and peanut butter inside it. I put a large treat in it on the first day ( months ago) and it is STILL stuck inside , so be careful with what size treats you put in. I have found regular dog food falls out easier but still keeps the dogs entertained. Bought this at the same time I bought Kong Quest Star Pod, and the Kong was in pieces in less than 20 minutes. I will absolutely be purchasing more dog products from PetSafe.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES the purple squirrel!
customer_reviews.text: We have had several of these squirrels and our dog LOVES them! They are very similar to a Kong toy but they have prongs in the round opening that helps keep the treats from coming out too easily. It takes my dog awhile to get all the treats (apples, carrots, cheese...) out once you stuff them in there! I used to buy them at Petsmart, but they quit selling them. Then I found them at another Pet store and they stopped selling them. Finally I found them on here and I bought 4 of them to make sure I had them for a while. Highly recommend if you have a dog that is good with puzzle toys!
customer_reviews.author: Jersey's Mom

customer_reviews.title: this thing is indestructible and the best dog toy I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This thing is indestructible. We have an 85 pound hound/shepherd mix and he typically goes through toys within days. But not this squirrel. We leave it every day with my dog, and stuff it full of small treats such as Zuke's, and it apparently gives him hours of fun, because he's stopped destroying things like pillows and blankets. The best dog toy I have ever purchased, hands down. This is a big heavy toy, so would not be appropriate for small dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Y

customer_reviews.title: Great for noisy neighborhood dog gift!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after reading how it keeps dogs occupied and stops barking. I have a neighbor that I don’t know who’s got a dog that barks nonstop and gave it to them with a note. I haven’t been bothered anymore by barking so it’s working!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C

customer_reviews.title: Treats don't come out!
customer_reviews.text: Once you put treats in it you or the dog can't get them out. I had to cut out all but one of the rubber teeth at the opening. Now it works like it should of from the beginning!
customer_reviews.author: Jannette J

customer_reviews.title: Tough materials
customer_reviews.text: Puppy really does Not play with it. Not as cute as I thought it would be. I think it’s too sturdy for a small puppy
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: Obie wasn’t sure about squirrel dude at first. He has the Kong wobbler and he easily had success with that just by knocking it around. Once he realized he could run around with squirrel dude in his mouth and throw him every which way to get the food out he’s been in heaven! He loves this thing! I use it with kibble to extend a feeding/keep him super occupied while I get some stuff done. I haven’t tried it with him in the crate yet but I’m sure he would throw it around in there and love it just the same! Don’t hesitate to buy! Obie is 22 lbs and we got the Medium size squirrel dude!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor D.

customer_reviews.title: Smell gave me a headache!
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 1 star, because it stinks so bad, I had to throw it away. Even on the patio, the smell made me sick.
customer_reviews.author: Shalome

customer_reviews.title: My dog isn't a huge fan, which is shocking.
customer_reviews.text: My dog Rosebud LOVES brain toys. She has a red kong. She has a blue kong genius (Mike edition). She has an ever-lasting treatball. A monster mouth. When I say my dog loves brain toys, I mean she doesn't let a day go buy without bringing me at LEAST one or two, requesting to have some treats put in, to play with it. And they're one of the few things she'll take off and be totally independent and entertained with by herself. But she just doesn't get into this one. It doesn't work well with treats that aren't the super expensive name brand treats made by the same company, it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Nerdzilla Mendenhall

customer_reviews.title: Miniature Schnazuers Destroy in 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: My Miniature Schnauzer can shred chew toys pretty easily. This one held up even less than the average chew toy. If your dog is a serious toy shredder - avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Abernethy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Super strong. Even our Great Dane puppy can’t destroy it! And he even carry’s it around the house and outside! Great toy I would recommend this toy for any size dog
customer_reviews.author: LARRY

customer_reviews.title: I Should have gotten the bigger size
customer_reviews.text: This "kong" toy works pretty good. I wanted to get something for my new 40 lb rescue dog who inhales his food. He loves playing with it and took about 1/2 hour the first couple of times to get all of his food out ( he always leaves 1-2 kibbles) He has now mastered it and it only occupies him for 15 min tops and then he's done, which is not enough time to distract him at 6;30 in the morning for when he wants to wake me me up. I should have gotten the bigger size because only about 1/4 cup of his dry food fits in it which is not nearly enough. Overall it's a good distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Storny

customer_reviews.title: Busy and durable doggy buddies
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs absolutely love these, and they're incredibly durable. We have three rather big dogs (50-75 lbs) and we use these twice a day. We put a few doggie cookies in there, smear in some peanut butter with a kitchen knife to make it interesting, and set the dogs loose on them. Each lasts at least a month or so for us, and we're glad to have a few spares ready for when one does need replacing after such regular and intense use. We look forward to continuing this for many years to come, and are very thankful for these fun busy buddies that definitely live up to their name.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Baker

customer_reviews.title: Love the squirrel
customer_reviews.text: It’s stronger than my younger girl’s chew. I put wet kibble in and freeze. My girls keep busy and quiet for awhile
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: Solid treats can get stuck in the toy and eventually mold.
customer_reviews.text: Solid treats get stuck inside and can be hard to remove from the toy. We only use peanut butter in the toy now and the dogs LOVE it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Hard to work
customer_reviews.text: It’s great but hard to get anything out because the opening is small and there are rubber pieces that hold treats in so my dog lost interest quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Good for dogs who need mental stimulation
customer_reviews.text: I cut one prong out since I have a large breed who eats good-sized kibble - this seems to dispense just enough to keep her interested without making her frustrated to the point of not playing with it anymore. She has several food toys that I swap out depending on what the rest of her activity is like for the day (how rainy it is outside, etc). This is among her favorites, and she will work at it in a dedicated fashion for quite a while, which I appreciate. She hasn't chewed this up, either, and she's chewed up a lot of other rubber toys.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Cook

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend to occupy your dog!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT toy to keep your dogs occupied. We put MILK-BONE® MaroSnacks Dog Treats in there and our dogs are occupied for at least 30 minutes, which is a long time in doggy time! Some recommendations mention using peanut butter with this product, I'd say do not use peanut butter because these are not easy to clean. We stick ours in the dish washer and they clean fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy B Legler

customer_reviews.title: Happy since I was able to gift it (after washing it lol)
customer_reviews.text: My dog didn’t like it at all but he’s extremely picky. My friends dogs loved it though so trust them and not mine lol
customer_reviews.author: Martha Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for a Doberman
customer_reviews.text: My Doberman loves this toy! I give her this toy with peanut butter and a treat inside it everyday for a mid-day snack. It is durable enough to withstand Doberman's teeth and keeps her occupied for a couple of hours. I do tend to replace this product every 3 months as it does crack and gets easy for her to get to the treats quicker, but it's a small price to pay for keeping a smart Doberman challenged.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Good for my heavy chewer
customer_reviews.text: My pup's goal is to destroy every toy he can, and the PetSafe Busy Buddy Squirrel Dude Dog Toy (Large) stands up to his gnawing. I haven't put much inside it, aside from peanut butter. It keeps him busy when I want to distract him, and cleans up easily in the sink with hot water.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

product_meta.title: PetSafe Busy Buddy Squirrel Dude Dog Toy, Treat Dispensing Dog Toy, X-Small, Small, Medium and Large Sizes
product_meta.description: Size:SmallIf your pup needs a toy to match his impressive chewing skills, the PetSafe Busy Buddy Squirrel Dude is up for the challenge. This durable chew toy has a fun bounce that keeps dogs playing longer. Our patented Treat Meter randomly dispenses treats while your dog plays; the flexible prongs can be trimmed to increase flow of treats. Stuff with dry treats, kibble, cheese or peanut butter. This durable toy is made of safe, non-toxic materials and is top-rack dishwasher safe. Available in small, medium and large. PetSafe brand is here to help you and your pet live happy together.
feature_bullets: TREAT STUFFER OPTIONS: Stuff with dry treats, cheese, peanut butter or kibble and mix it up
SAFE FOR YOUR PET: This durable toy is made of safe, non-toxic materials
QUALITY GUARANTEED: PetSafe brand has been a trusted global leader in pet behavior, containment and lifestyle innovations for nearly 30 years; we help pets and their people live happy together
TOUGH CHEW TOY: Stands up to aggressive chewing and the fun bounce keeps dogs playing longer
KEEPS BORED PETS BUSY: Our patented Treat Meter dispenses treats randomly while your dog plays; the flexible prongs can be trimmed to increase flow of treats
EASY TO CLEAN: Top-shelf dishwasher safe
SMALL DOGS: Designed for dogs 10-20 pounds
USA-BASED CUSTOMER CARE: Let our pet product experts help; we’re available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions at 1-800-845-3274

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
